Name: Eleven: International Players Expansion
Description:
A set of Player cards dedicated to advanced play, and a new Travel mechanic.

An expansion introducing new Players with interesting abilities and showing the wonderful diversity of football around the globe, and a new Travel mechanic.
 New Players and Tactics from around the world
Discover 45 new Player cards representing 45 different countries and 5 new Tactic cards showing specific styles of play, such as Spanish tiki-taka, German gegenpressing, or English kick and rush.
This set of Player cards is especially useful in advanced play as each of them adds an interesting ability.
 Travel mechanic
Travel between different continents by spending Distance markers to purchase the best international Players for your club.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eleven: International Cup Expansion
Description:
Do you have what it takes to play in the league on weekends and in the International Cup on Wednesdays?
 The International Cup expansion introduces a single-elimination tournament board where winning each match is of utmost importance.
 It also adds 14 International teams and 50 new cards, including Board Meeting cards showing International events, and new Opponent cards for the added teams.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eleven: Solo Campaign Expansion
Description:
A big solo campaign consisting of 8 scenarios tied together by an overarching story. Play a series of games throughout several seasons with the goal of reaching the big league. Whatever happens in one scenario may influence the scenarios that follow. 
 This expansion adds 36 Solo cards that affect gameplay and your progress in the campaign, as well as 14 new cards for the multiplayer mode including new Objective, Director, and Board Meeting cards, increasing the overall variability in the base game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Doggy Scratch
Description:
Why does everything itch? I can't stop scratching! Oh no! Are those... fleas? Use your cards to get rid of them and pass them on to your opponents. Be smart and get rid of as many fleas as you can, but watch out for veteran fleas, because they are tricky customers.

Be the dog with the least fleas at the end of the game and win. Are you starting to feel your whole body itch?

When it is their turn, the player plays as many action cards from their hand as they want. Once they have played, they decide whether to draw 1, 2 or 3 cards from the deck and they say this out loud. Next, they draw the number of cards they have said, one after the other. They put the action cards they have drawn into their hand and the flea cards in front of them. The player's turn then ends and they cannot play any more cards. The turn passes to the player on the left.

The game ends as soon as one of the players collects 5 flea cards in front of them.

That player cannot win the game. The rest of the players count the number of fleas they have on each card, and whoever has the fewest wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who has the fewest veteran fleas wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape from the Two Base Stations
Description:
Escape from the Two Base Stations is a new style of escape game kit that allows two players in different locations to play together using a video call app of their choice.

With no time limit on it, anyone can experience an authentic escape game with this game kit! The only catch? You'll need to find a friend to send the other half of the game kit to, and cooperate with each other to solve the puzzles.

One side will have the "North Pole Kit" and the other will have the "South Pole Kit". Progress through the story together by sharing information from each unique kit through a video call app of your choice.

This remote communication game must be played by 2 parties over video call, where one side has the North Pole Kit and the other side has the South Pole Kit physically with them. The game cannot be played with only one of the kits.

Name: Stjæl et rim
Description:
A Danish rhyming game with a stack of picture cards.

At the beginning of the game, a card is flipped.
Each player will spend their turn flipping a new card and seeing if two cards rhyme (like 'house' and 'mouse' - this rhyme also woks in English). Cards that are also in a trick can also be taken, stealing the trick. If there is a rhyme, the player takes the cards as a trick. If not, the newly flipped card is placed on the table next to the already flipped card(s). If the active player sees no rhyme, the other players may see if they can find a rhyme and take the trick.

Keep going until all cards have been flipped and potentially converted into tricks. The player with most cards wins.

Name: Hunt A Killer: The Moon Summit Mystery Box Set
Description:
A graduate student named Toby Mendia appears to have died from a fatal bear attack while on a scientific expedition in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Although the case closed in the summer of 2018, a friend of Toby’s has reached out to you, thinking there might be something strange surrounding his death. Was Toby murdered? If so, why – and by whom?

Players channel their inner detective to investigate the suspected murder in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Uncover the motives of each suspect through ciphers, clues, and puzzles that progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

The Moon Summit Mystery Complete Box Set contains the full season (6 episodes) of the previous Hunt A Killer subscription series.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

Name: Terraternity: The Card Challenge
Description:
Terraternity: The Card Challenge is a fast-playing strategic card game for 2-6 players. Master a touch of dexterity and overcome the challenges of reducing CO2 with renewable energy sources.

Your goal is to develop renewable power plants in various countries to make them carbon neutral. You will first need to play a country card to ‘activate’ it, which lets you build renewable power plants within it but adding its CO2 output - literally! - to the Terraternity globe. You’ll need to make sure this globe stays balanced - too many CO2 cubes, and you risk a climate disaster. Whoever balances five countries first is the winner!

Name: Trial by Cipher
Description:
The Infiniti Institutes is an institution like no other.  They are dedicated to discovering truth wherever it may be hidden and preserving it for all to experience.  Their methods are, however, far from stodgy academics one might imagine.

With field agents across the globe infiltrating every nook and cranny of the world, data is constantly incoming.  Of course, it's largely encoded, so The Institutes department of cryptography is its largest and most-funded, seeking out the best and brightest every year to join its ranks.

Trial by Cipher is your entrance exam. Do you have what it takes to join The Institutes and assist with the Great Understanding?

Name: Kingdoms: Ascendance
Description:
A card game played with a standard 52-card deck (plus 2 Jokers). This is a hack of War which adds strategy without losing the spirit of the original game.

In Kingdoms: Ascendance, wage war in a duel on 3 fronts, protect your castles, and weaken the opposing forces. Your goal is to earn cards and win wars, but as you continue to play, exhaustion starts to set in--forcing you to make compromises to your castles and pray that a war doesn’t occur. You always feel about as close to winning as you are to losing.

The game is played in 3 phases: Draw Cards, Play Cards (initiate War), and Recruit.

If a player is unable to draw up to their hand size, unable to contribute to War, or have only 1 castle standing--that player immediately loses.

The game has no win condition, only 3 lose conditions. This reflects our own beliefs that war has no winners. Even when you have technically won the game, you may look down at your Kingdom and realize how much weaker it has become than when you started.

Name: Migratory Patterns
Description:
The present becomes the past.  Fact becomes legend.  And artifacts become myth.  Throughout the ages countless works of immeasurable beauty and history have been lost to the ravages of time, their memory turned into nothing more than whispers of something that probably never existed...

...or did it?

Now, an Institutes researcher has tracked down some of these artifacts, scattered around the world in dusty, forgotten corners just waiting to be discovered and shown to the world.  But The Institutes aren't the only ones looking for these treasures, and the others' intentions aren't nearly so altruistic.  So hurry and decipher the incoming data so field agents can be dispatched to retrieve the artifacts before it's too late!

Name: Cryptic Cryptids
Description:
How much do you know about the creatures that populate the earth right alongside us?  Zoology is a rich field, filled with millions of species and sub-species.  And that's to say nothing of its sister field: cryptozoology.

One of the smallest departments at The Institutes, the department of cryptozoology is made up of just four very dedicated people.  Largely a theoretical field, little concrete data has ever existed over the years.  But with your help, that is about to change

One department member has set out on a research trip to verify unsubstantiated claims of a number of cryptids.  Their trip has gone from pleasant to dangerous in the blink of an eye, and all of it will be for naught if you can't decode and catalog the information they've sent back.

Name: Veritas
Description:
The combined library of human knowledge here on earth dwindles in comparison to the knowledge spread through the universe around us.  Secrets that we can only scratch the surface of lurk just beyond our grasp.

Now, you have a chance to uncover some of the greatest secrets of the cosmos, knowledge that will alter the way you see the world and your place in it.

You may never be the same again after deciphering the messages you've received from an old Institutes alum, but you're going to do your best despite that.  After all, this is what you signed up for.

Name: ENIGMAS
Description:
A multi-layered Puzzle Hunt experience within a luxury deck of playing cards. Solve puzzles, crack codes and discover secret messages!

ENIGMAS combines all of these exciting and intriguing worlds. Puzzles within puzzles within puzzles, within a luxury deck of custom playing cards. And all of this is themed on an estate shrouded in mystery called Riverbank ...

Included within this fully functional, seemingly regular deck of playing cards are four very special cards, each with its own puzzle for you to solve.

Solving all four puzzles will unlock an incredible, multilayered, eight-step puzzle hunt expertly designed by Dave Shukan, master puzzle-maker. Combine answers from every puzzle you've solved along the way and you will reveal the final, meta-puzzle answer. A true puzzler’s paradise!

ENIGMAS are themed on a fascinating historical place -- a mysterious estate outside of Chicago called Riverbank. Over one hundred years ago, the scientists at Riverbank worked on cryptography projects: the estate was filled with secret messages and codes. And exotic animals like alligators, peacocks, monkeys and bears roamed the property!

Illustrator Billy French has masterfully captured all of these bizarre and beautiful elements into the ENIGMAS design. The card backs are adorned with historically accurate imagery from the Riverbank estate, like its windmill and lighthouse. Owls, representing wisdom and learning, are perched on the bookshelves, guarding its secrets.

Name: Do You Have What It Takes?
Description:
Test your investigative skills and join a top-secret unit with QuestAir! Designed by air force fighter pilots, your escape game in a box features 12 intricate puzzle cards that lead you and your teammates through thrilling challenges. Scribble, search, and calculate, typing your findings into our interactive website. Do you have what it takes? Find out with your escape room game!

Immerse yourself in a world of riddles, codes, and secrets with your interactive game! Though complex in design, your game is simple to follow and includes helpful hints if you get stumped. Log onto the corresponding website using your game’s code to type in answers, check their validity, and complete your tryout’s stages. Pore over your 12 puzzle cards, investigating answers like a super spy, scribbling notes, calculating problems, and searching for answers. After you’ve completed all 12 cards and entered your correct answers, you officially become part of our top-secret intelligence unit!

Name: Pizza Puzzles: Meat Lovers
Description:
Pizza Puzzles bring delicious art and a fun jigsaw puzzle experience to your table. Our pizzas are silly and fun to look at, but more importantly, they're puzzles you can build with your friends and family. A single slice is just one of eight smaller puzzles in the box. As you complete each smaller puzzle, you can assemble the entire pizza by slice. On each pizza you'll find countless toppings - the more you look, the more details you'll find!

Puzzles come with symbols on the back of the pieces, allowing you to assemble your puzzle by slice! Pick your preferred slice (maybe the one with your favorite topping) and chow down. Friends and family can race to finish their piece of the pie.

Name: Zealand 1985
Description: One of the parts of the Warsaw Pact plan to attack into the west was to invade Danish Zealand, along with the capital, Copenhagen. An improvised corps, including the 6th Airborne Division, 7th Sea Landing Division and the 15th Mechanized Division, was prepared for this operation. The Soviet units and the regiment from German Democratic Republic's army were kept in reserve. The opponent of the Poles was the "Zealand" Corps. Important part of the planned strike was the usage of nuclear missiles.

Name: Great Northern War: Kalisz 1706
Description:
Game covers several battles of the "Polish" part of the Great Northern War, a major conflict fought at the beginning of XVII century, when Saxony, Russia and Dennmark attacked Sweden. Thanks to the leadership skills of the Carolux XII, Swedish army won several battles during this war.

"Kalisz 1705" allows to recreate couple of battles of this war - small scale skirmish at Tylewice 1704, medium battle - Poniec 1704 and two major battles - Wschowa (Fraustadt) 1706 and Kalisz 1706.

Game uses Husaria system rules, slightly modiefied for the more infantry based battles than usually in this system.

Name: Kittens Love Sushi
Description:
In Kittens Love Sushi, your goal is to lure 5 kittens, from the street, into your home, by using sushi as the currency that attracts them—all while other players attempt to thwart your progress, of course. It's guaranteed to be one of the most adorable games about kittens, or sushi, that you ever play.

Each turn, players fill their hand to 4 cards.  Players play a single action from their hand each turn, then play a number of sushi cards to attract a "kitten" from the row of kitten cards on the board into their house.

The first player to rescue 5 kittens wins.

Name: Ooze
Description:
As you play Ooze, your goal is to collect the ingredients necessary to make the tastiest smoothie, according to those listed on "recipe" cards. Those who make the most delicious drink, win the game! And, of course, you're an even bigger winner if you actually play this game while sipping on a smoothie—which I highly recommend.

Each player has a hand of 8 cards and draws one card and discards one card each turn.   If a card is discarded with a special action, follow the card text.

Each player has 5 turns of drawing/discarding.   At the end of  this the player wins the round who has the most ingredients in their hand from a smoothie recipe in their hand.   Ties are broken with any "base" cards (milk, juice, or water) that might also be in the hand.

The player winning 3 rounds wins the game.

Name: RED
Description:
Little Red Riding Hood is back, and she wants her revenge against The Big Bad Wolf. How will she get it? Well, she's acquired a couple of supernatural powers, of course! Namely, the ability to create multiples of herself, and make forest trees sprout up suddenly from the ground. Will it be enough to show the wolf she means business? In this 2 player game, you play as either Red or the Wolf, and then switch roles to play again.

The Red player draws 3 cards a turn and places them in an expanding grid with new cards touching an old card orthogonally.

The Wolf player moves one space a turn orthogonally or diagonally trying to "eat" any "Red" card by entering that card's space.

The match ends when the deck is exhausted or the Wolf is surrounded on all sides and plays a "Red" card on top of the Wolf.

Then players switch roles and play another match.  The winner is the wolf who eats the most "Red" cards.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Little Red Riding Hood

Name: Kaiju Siege: Kaisen Expansion
Description:
Injured kaiju started to retreat to the ocean. Your shogun will have none of that, and has ordered a pursuit to end the kaiju siege once and for all. You readied your atakebune warship and prepared your troops for a battle at sea.

This expansion for Kaiju Siege comes with an alternate game board and 4 new kaiju. Battles may now take place out at sea, where your workers run the risk of falling overboard, and the kaiju can damage your ship's hull and cause it to spring a leak. This understandably introduces a new losing condition - your ship can sink!

The four new kaiju are also compatible with the game board from the base game.

The base game is required in order to play this expansion.

Name: 5-Up!
Description:
Add as many of your favourite fruit the the fruit salad as possible but, don't be too obvious! The Investigator is watching, trying to deduce what your favourite fruit is! If you can get the most of your favourite fruit in the salad without getting caught, then you'll get a load of points!

Each round you will be playing and taking Fruit Cards from the middle of the table, placing them in front of you. These cards in front of you count as points at the end of the round for whoever has the matching Favourite Fruit Card.

Throw the Investigator off your trail by adding different Fruit Cards but, every Fruit Card you add that isn't your favourite might be one for someone else!

—description from the designer

Name: Monsterjäger Erweiterung
Description: Monsterjäger Erweiterung contains four new "monster-thwacking" devices and 27 "shadow" monster cards that depict the 27 possible monsters from the base game, but only in silhouette. The rules in this expansion include two variants, one allowing you to play solely with the shadow cards and another that combines the two decks of monster cards.

Name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Two
Description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 2 includes 4 Time-Spaces:

     Uruk 4100 BC
     Paris 845 AD
     California 1805 AD
     London 1905 AD


Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:

     Hattori Hanzo
     Fujibayashi Nagato
     Ishikawa Goemon


—description from the designer

Name: Topsy Timbers
Description:
A team tower building dexterity game with elements of chance and sabotage. Teams compete to build the tallest tower with dice rolls determining a) their share of the finite collective timber resource and b) their chance at sabotaging the opposing tower with rubber band artillery. Built around a dynamic game box which converts to a dice tower for game play. The boss went home early leaving you and the crew to manage the timberyard. Grab the keys to the crane, it's time to have some fun... Build a taller tower than your friends before the timberyard runs dry!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge
Description:
Zombie Apocalypse: Rebuild Refuge is a semi co-op party game for 3-8 players. The game takes place in a world infected by the zombie virus. Most of the residents in your society were zombified. Luckily, or unluckily, you are immune to the virus and have survived in the apocalypse. It is yet the time to let your guard down. Your first goal is to survive and if there is still any luck, you may find rescue from the outside. Therefore, you must construct refuge units in haste to stay away from danger. Not long ago, you have met some other survivors who are in a similar condition to you. Be careful! In this difficult time, no one can be trusted. They may not be your alliance! Keep your fingers crossed and watch your back!

—description from the publisher

Name: Peace: A Card Game
Description:
Make peace, not war! This hopeful twist on the classic game of "War" challenges players to outdo each other with increasingly generous acts of kindness. Each card depicts a good deed ranging from simple things (I picked you flowers) to grand gestures (I love you). The most thoughtful act wins the round and if there's a tie, players must find peace.

—description from the publisher

Name: Disuko!
Description:
Disuko! is an abstract puzzle strategy sudoku dice game in which players strive to run out of their dice first by taking turns rerolling, moving, and/or placing their dice on a 6x6 sudoku grid. Extra actions are acquired by completing sections of the board (rows, columns, boxes, or the sixth of any number). Players must keep an eye out for opportunities to block opponents and to acquire as many actions as possible in order to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Lanista
Description:
You are a lanista, a gladiator school manager and trainer, aiming to become the most prestigious of Rome.

The game turn plays in four phases: Recruitment, during which you buy gladiator slaves from the market; Contract Negotiation, during which you try to place your gladiators in spectacles; Combat, during which you have your gladiators fight each other; and Healing and Resting, during which prestige may be earned from happy accidents.

The game is based on extensive historical research. The gladiator names are authentic, as well as the equipment sets and pairings.

Recruitment: On the market are gladiators. Each has a cost in gold and an equipment set (provocator, thrace, retiary, etc.). Some have special abilities.
Contract Negotiations: Various cities have gladiatorial games for tender. They rake in a certain amount of money and fame but require specific gladiator teams.
Combat: Each lanista organizes one or more fights between their own gladiators. Random draws determine the outcomes. Players can manipulate the odds in various ways.
Healing & Resting: If a gladiator physical integrity is compromised, he must be healed...or there can be an accident that yields prestige.

Random draws use a bag loaded with tokens of various colours. Players manipulate the token counts to influence the odds. This matches electoral systems used in Antiquity.

Lanista is accessible and educational; it will please newbies and grognards, be they inclined to compete or to manage.

Name: Plaka
Description:
Plaka is a highly thematic Economic, about managing and expanding a Clothes Store in the old historical neighborhood of Athens, with Worker Placement and tile placement elements and a unique Flow mechanism.

In the game, players are the owners of a small clothes store and they try to operate it in a way that it will attract the most of the tourists passing by, serve them and get the most benefits from the trades. To achieve this, players hire workers and pitchmen, expand their stores trying to get the most of the small place they can use, advertise their business, and even sell some of their goods via their e-shop.

The game lasts 8 rounds. 
Each turn is divided by 3 phases:
The Action Phase, that is a worker placement phase. 
The Flow Phase where the micromanagement of the employees, customers and clothes happens.
The Upkeep phase, where players pay the rent and their employees, as well as they setup the game for next round.

By the end of the game, players score the customers they served, their reputation, as well as they lose some Victory Points for every customer left inside their store and the tiles on the board that were left unoccupied.

The player who managed to get the most out of their store, is the winner!

Name: Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39
Description:
Revolution & Reaction: The Spanish Civil War, 1930-39 is a two-player wargame, depicting the political and military conflicts in Spain between 1930 and 1939. In the game, one player controls the Republican forces (consisting of liberals, socialists, communists and anarchists), and the other controls the Nationalists (consisting of the Falangist and Carlist factions).

Players not only fight each other, but must manage and coordinate their own political and military factions. The loyalty of your factions to the cause is never certain!

The game system adapts the key mechanics of Matt Calkin's Sekigahara game (2011, GMT). Players receive a hand of cards each turn which are used to play for the actions, and to deploy game pieces into battle. In Revolution & Reaction, there is a political phase, in which players try to gain political control of the various areas of Spain by placing influence blocks; in the military phase, players move their units and start combats in locations on the board (towns cities). Blocks and cards are hidden from the other player, so the opponent's true political and military strength is only know in struggle.

The game includes diplomacy and elections, special units (such as the International Brigades), and rules to simulate the outbreak of war, giving the game a strong connection to the real history of the Spanish Civil War.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Escaping The Bolsheviks: A Solo Game
Description:
The war is not going well... 
Command a small group of White Russians trying to escape from the pursuing Bolsheviks.

An easy to learn and play solo game ideal for 28mm figures but any scale will work without much problem.

TURN SEQUENCE 
1- Move your forces 
2- Roll for Bolshevik reinforcements 
3- Move Bolshevik forces 
4- Roll for random events

Name: S.O.S Donald!
Description:
Donald has left the bath water running, and everyone jumps from piece of furniture to piece of furniture to arrive outside on dry feet. The furniture is laid out next to each other, the sofa in the middle. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice, with a color you jump with the matching figure from the left onto the next piece of furniture, with the white joker you can move your own figure, with the arrow you move any figure back one piece of furniture, whoever is the first to have both figures of his team dry wins.

—user summary

Name: Take That Towers
Description:
Take That Towers is a tactical card game centered around dual-use cards with delayed effects.

Players build skyscrapers together. Each turn they'll play cards from their hand face-up to construct floors and face-down to stake their claim on the resulting real estate. Once a tower is completed, the effects of each floor will occur and players score points based on the arrangement. Score the most points before the deck runs out to win.

The game plays using a single 65 deck of square cards, and plays in a consistent amount of time regardless of the player count.

Name: Toggolino: Sternenfänger
Description:
Toggolino has lost his lucky star during a romp and it has shattered into many small pieces, which Toggolino and his friends now want to find.

The player whose turn it is rolls the dice: For a color he goes to the next matching field, if it is a star field, he may take a puzzle piece and put it on. As a reward, they get a colored star. If the star is rolled, the player takes a puzzle piece and gets a reward star. For the lucky star, the player moves to the next free mushroom and gets a reward star. When the star is finished, the player with the most points on his stars wins.

—user summary

Name: Der Maulwurf ist immer dabei
Description:
The game consists of 32 cards in 8 colors, with associated frame and a die. 4 cards of each color are placed in the frames in a certain order (predetermined by the bulges on the cards) into the frames. A set = color shows in each case the mole with his friends with different activities or events in attractive graphics. The variation of the game goes from finishing or getting to know a picture to a complicated exchange or dice game.

—user summary

Name: Mafia the Party Game Deluxe Edition
Description:
Mafia is a game of lying, bluffing, and deceit where players try to eliminate the other team from the game. There are two teams; Mafia and Civilians. The game is divided into two phases; night and day. The Civilians win if they eliminate all the Mafia players and the Mafia win if they equal or outnumber the Civilian players. Mafia is played with a Moderator. The Moderator guides the players through the night and day phases, keeping the game on track and keeping the players engaged.

Mafia Deluxe features 47 unique roles on 84 role cards, a moderator field guide, and quick start guide.

Name: 18DE: Germany
Description:
â€‹â€‹18DE: Germany – This is a more conventional operational game that uses the great merger/conversion system from 1817, but strips out the short selling. It plays fast and it feels like a full game experience in only 3-4 hours.

Medium (3-4h) 1817-style game, but with no short sales.

Rules changes from 1817:
- No short selling
- No NY, but there are OO tiles (tile layer chooses orientation and token placement like in 1830). 
- OO tiles use the route restriction from the NY tiles in 1817 (may not include both cities in a hex on the same route).
- New private company auction process
  - All set out for sale, put $10 chip bonus money on each private company (player that drafts the card gets the bonus money)
  - PD goes first (keeps PD), may select a private company or pass (out of current round of draft if pass), then take turns around the table drafting or passing a private company until all have passed.
  - Pass PD to next player and place a $10 chip on remaining private companies.
  - Repeat this process until all sold, PD goes to the next player in turn order after the player that drafted the last item
- New private companies
  - River Bridge Builders, face value 60
    - One time use. Owning company may place a tile of the next available color out of phase in a OO hex following the normal track building rules.
  - Western Europe Connections, face value 40
    - Owning company may place the red “W” tile on Brussels, Amsterdam, or Paris (match orientation). If not placed during its first operation, any company may place it during their operation.
  - Eastern Europe Connections, face value 40
    - Owning company may place the red “E” tile on Warsaw, Prague, Vienna (match orientation). If not placed during its first operation, any company may place it during their operation.
- “E” and “W” tiles
  - This tile now counts as a 10 revenue off-board area. If a route contains both the “E” and “W” off-board areas, it also includes the respective bonuses (“+”) revenue in the route’s value per the phase color. Both hexes must be counted in a single train’s run to earn the bonuses.
  - E tile (may be placed in Amsterdam, Brussels, Paris--match spikes)
    - 2 connections, 10 value, +40,+50,+70,+100
  - W tile (may be placed in Warsaw, Prague, Vienna--match spike)
    - 1 one connection, 10 value, +40,+50,+70,+100

Name: Project Luna
Description:
In the near future, corporations of Earth get the mandate to explore and exploit the Moon for resources and science in order to push forward humanity's dream of living among the stars. You, as a player, are placed in a position of a manager on Luna.

Your job is to, first, make your colony as self sustaining as possible by playing different projects, making way for advanced industries and science that build up the prestige of your company - the main parameter for determining the victor in the end. Everything in game is based on hard science - no sci-fi elements included.

During the turn, players have a lot of options - playing cards, rolling dice to research new tech and build decks of cards, place buildings on the map and move units on the same map. They can trade on a common and ever changing market, start missions (represented by some other cards) on distant planets, and finish tasks from the common deck.

The game ends when any player finishes a series of secret task (agendas) that he gets via cards at the game's start. That turn becomes the last one.

The player wins by accumulating the most victory points (prestige points in game) that are gathered through various actions during the game.

Name: Federation & Empire: Combined Operations – Rulebook 2021 Edition
Description:
Combined Operations has more rules for Federation & Empire. 
It is newly improved and updated, having gone through extensive review and discussion during Stratcon 2021. All rules questions from ADB, Inc.’s BBS and Captain’s Log issues have been addressed to provide the best experience for every empire.

This product includes many new concepts (stasis field generators, electronic warfare, light tactical transports, monitors, special units, and Marines), which enhance play value by providing players with new ways to destroy their enemies. New economic factors include commercial convoys, base stations, and PF storage depots. You can take the fight to the planet with ground combat, including special attack forces. Prime teams can help in combat or aid in capturing a ship, along with other abilities.

And there are scenarios galore! 
Koval’s Lightning has Klingons and the Federation facing off;
Thunder over Kzintai has Kzintis, Lyrans, and Klingons; 
The Hydran Expedition has Hydrans trying to get to Federation territory without being stopped by the Klingons; 
The Wayward Wind explores what would have happened if the Coalition had attacked the Hydrans first, rather than the Kzintis; 
Reptilicon Revenged has Romulans and Gorns; 
Cold Front can be used as a training scenario with the experienced player commanding the Hydrans and newer players commanding the Coalition; 
Tholian Gambit has the Klingons facing the Tholians; 
The Late Kingdom explores what would have happened if the Hydrans had to start the General War by reconquering their territory.

You will need the Federation & Empire 2010 Rulebook and various countersheets to use this expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Backpacking Through Europe Card Game
Description:
Europe is rich with history, culture, and wonderful people calling to you and your fellow backpackers to see as much as you can. In the Backpacking Through Europe Card Game the traveler who has the most memorable trips, wins!

The Backpacking Through Europe Card Game is a goal-driven hand management game that challenges players to craft carefully considered trips around Europe. On your turn you will decide whether to TRAVEL or PLAN the next stage of your trip.

To TRAVEL, play a single card from your hand matching exactly 1 transportation icon from your most recently played card.

To PLAN, take all cards of a single country from a public pool and add them to your hand.

Each destination a player visits provides them with victory points and bonus points can be earned by fulfilling the conditions of goal cards. Some goals include visiting the most destinations in a certain country, having trips of certain lengths, using specific kinds of transportation, and for making perfect round trip itineraries where your last destination provides transportation back to your first destination.

Goal cards change every game causing players to adapt to ever changing criteria for judging the value of a trip.

The backpacker who earns the most points, wins!

Name: Vilitum
Description:
“Ah, Vilitum! Of my discoveries in the strange land that is Camria, this has been my most treasured! An elegant game of strategy and wit. A game of kings and peasants alike."

Vilitum is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. Each player controls an army of 5 unique units. If you defeat all of your opponent's units, or if they surrender, you win!

On each turn a player may move and/or attack with 1 piece. If a piece receives enough damage, it is removed from the board. Each unit has a unique combination of movement, attack range, and special ability.

For younger players, or for your first game, a simplified rule set gets players use to the basics, and adding in the advance rules opens the DEEP strategy of Vilitum.

Adding in the Soldier Expansion gives each player a new unit. Each player now has a pair of soldiers, that while having the lowest life, are tough, and if they are adjacent, deal extra damage.

Name: After the Last Sky: The First Intifada 1987-1993
Description:
After the Last Sky simulates the first Palestinian Intifada, from 1987-1993.  The game system is a custom implementation of the classic Card Driven Game (CDG) mechanism combined with new mechanisms that simulate civil unrest on a strategic scale.  In the game 2 players simulate the First Palestinian Intifada.  One side is the Unified National Leadership of the Uprising (UNLU) composed of the Palestinian community leadership within the Israeli occupied territories of the Gaza Strip and West Bank.  The other side is the conservative Likud-led Israeli government (ISR).  Hamas acts as a situationally controllable faction that acts more independently from the UNLU - helping and hindering both factions at different times.

Issuing Operations and exploiting events, players recruit and deploy units to control territory and/or foment uprising. The game is played over 3 rounds composed of hands of cards that are played as actions or events.  If, after this time, the Israeli player cannot maintain national will (support for the conservative administration), they will lose the game.

The UNLU’s goals are two-fold: 1) sustain on-board protests and transition them into general strikes, and 2) influence international concern by engaging in non-violent efforts.  ISR aims to control the occupied territories by 1) suppressing civil disobedience in map locations, and 2) establishing intelligence networks within the communities to implant operatives or encourage collaboration with the Israeli Defense Force (IDF) in suppressing the civil unrest.

Additionally, automatic victory conditions exist for both sides. The UNLU player may win if international concern sways in their favor; that is, in the form of UN intervention due to human rights abuses. The Israeli player may automatically win if they deploy all of their intelligence networks, effectively snuffing out the resistance at the source.

Name: Ardennes Plus+: Volume One
Description:
Ardennes Plus is a grand strategic level simulation of 20th century conflicts in the densely forested and rough terrain of the Ardennes region of France, Luxembourg and Belgium.  This game features scenarios have been created for the Battle of the Bulge WWII December 1944.

The game uses Army level command structures to simulate supply and command in divisional and corps level units.  The game optionally represents the fog of war that was very common in the rough country of the Ardennes, by offering 2 hidden movement systems.

The low counter density, and high map scale is used to create conditions for fast play and resolution is possible in less than 2 hours. Event card options are also incldued to add historical flavour to this classic battle, based on the geopolitic and technical events that occured at the time.

The game can be played solo, as a two player game, with one player commanding the Allied forces, and one the German forces, or as a three player game, with two players playing the Allied forces (one playing Commonwealth forces and one playing USA forces), and the third player commanding the German forces.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Three
Description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 3 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
Laurentia 530M BC
Sydney 1776 AD
Chicago 1930 AD
London 4100 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
Kido Yazaemon
Kato Danzo
Jiraiya

Name: Kingdoms of Akandia: The Seven Realms
Description:
Welcome to Kingdoms of Akandia "The Seven Realms".

The first volume in an extensive, immersive and FULL-cooperative open world. You and your friends are fighting together against the spreading darkness. You choose your group of heroes and have your own adventure over 3 chapters and 35-65 hours of gameplay with 1-4 players.

Some mechanics:


    open world "The Seven Realms"
    supply chains / resource management
    full co-op group abilities
    use mounts
    mix of card and dice-fighting system
    upgrade tower defense
    destiny cards which changes every gameplay
    and much more

Name: Rainbow Friends
Description:
Way up in Cloudlandia is where the Rainbow Friends live – Kody Koala, Cammy Chameleon, Penny Penguin and Lazy Lou. These four friends create beautiful rainbows together when the sun is shining through the rain.

Valuable cloud crystals can be found where these rainbows touch the ground. Grab them by proving you have a good eye for distance and size.

The first player to collect three golden cloud crystals wins the sparkling collection game!

Name: Balon Prisionero
Description:
Grab the ball, choose your target and throw the ball as hard and fast as you can! You have to eliminate or be eliminated!

It is a team sport in which players must eliminate their opponents by hitting them with a ball. The winner is the team that eliminates first 6 of the 10 players of the opposing team.
This board game recreates this renowned and fun sport by using a customized die. This die will be rolled on the Player cards to try to eliminate them and to be victorious!

Ability when you throw the dice and action cards are the key for get de victory!!

Balon Prisionero ("Dodgeball") is a amazing cardgame for 2 players.

—description from the designer

Name: Story Colors
Description:
Roll the dice and make up a story! The player who guesses the hidden colors in it will be the winner.

To be the first player to move completely around the Scoring board. You will move forward by winning victory points telling the best stories, when you are narrator, and guessing the correct color sequence during other´s players stories.

With personalize dice, screens, decision boards, scoring board and cards with the beginning of stories, Story Colors is a funny party boardgame for all family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Spirit Island: Finder unsichtbarer Wege
Description:
The German version of the Finder of Paths Unseen spirit promo for Spirit Island. Pegasus Spiele released the spirits from Spirit Island: Promo Pack 2 seperately.

„Finder unsichtbarer Wege ist den Dahan wohlbekannt: Er durchquert mühelos die Insel und die meisten Geister-Redner haben ihn schon getroffen. Er kommuniziert direkter als andere Geister, indem er seine hohen Triller mit Ebenen von Gedanken überlagert. Manchmal hilft er Seelen gestorbener Dahan auf ihrem Weg, bevor bösartige Geister sie verschlingen können. Obwohl er allgegenwärtig ist, bleibt er rätselhaft. Sogar die Dahan, die ihn den Wegbereiter nennen, sind sich nicht sicher, ob er wirklich neue Wege erschafft oder findet, was bereits da ist. Ist die Parallelwelt, durch die er sich bewegt, überhaupt räumlich oder eine andere Daseinsform? Die Gedanken, die er kommuniziert, sind so fremdartig, dass sie sich nur schwer in Worte fassen lassen.

Finder unsichtbarer Wege ist ein zusätzlicher Geist für Spirit Island mit sehr hoher Komplexität Dieser Geist bewegt die meiste Zeit Invasoren und manchmal Dahan, Präsenzen oder Tiere. Dadurch (und durch reichlich Isolieren) kann er gut invasorenfreie, „sichere“ Zonen schaffen. Ohne eine Möglichkeit vernichtete Präsenzen zurück ins Spiel zu bringen, kann er es sich nur selten leisten, Invasoren zu zerstören. Daher benötigt er eine passende Starke Fähigkeit – oder Mitspieler, die ihn bei Angriffen unterstützen. Da er die Topologie der Insel ändert, steigert sich die Komplexität für alle Spieler – vor allem in größeren Spielen!“

Name: The Protection of Turalia
Description:
Turalia is a democratic land, where people vote for the government every few years. Now is time to vote for a new president but, in an unfortunate coincidence, a fire has started in the north of the land. Join other candidates to stop the fire. But do not lose sight of the people votes: there can be only one president.

The protection of Turalia is a familiar semi cooperative game for 2 to 4 players. Suggested age is from 10 years and game complexity is low. Each game will take about 30 to 45 minutes. Game materials are a main board, a secondary board, some cardboard tiles and the following components in five colors: wooden cubes, wooden discs and six sided dice.

The game main mechanic is action selection. Players will throw dices and group them by values. A player will select a dice from a group and, for each other dice on that group, the fire will advance. If a city has too much fire, the fire will be out of control in that city. If that happens in too many cities, players will lose the game.

Then, the player will perform some actions and deploy some new units in the south. At the end of the turn, if there are enough units in a city, that city will be fortified. But only one player can fortify the city. Also, fortifying cities will improve all players actions: more movement, more fire extinction, etc. And the player with more cities fortified will win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: 신묘한 사다리 (Mysterious Ladder)
Description:
Race to the Gold Coconut!
On a bountiful and rugged mountain live the descendants of the Monkey King. These monkeys are now looking for new leadership. It all began with the rumor of a golden coconut at the mountain peak. Excited, the monkeys decided that the one to claim this coconut would become the leader. The first player to reach the top receives the Gold Coconut and wins.

Players roll a die and move up the levels of the pyramid -- unless they hit a space with a slide which sends them back to the previous level.

A 3D Snakes & Ladders type of game.

Name: Tagiron: Mini Expansion
Description: As part of the 10th anniversary of the board game cafe Jelly Jelly, the store released this mini expansion for Tagiron.  The expansion consists of 5 new question cards (such as "How many prime numbers do you have?") and two 10 tiles, one each in blue and red.

Name: Cat-Astrophe
Description:
Have stacks of fun with purrrfect kitties to stack as high as you can. Will you be able to balance them all or will the game end in cat-astrophe?

Challenge yourself or take it in turns with friends to stack those kitties. Make sure to stay pawsitive and keep a steady hand. Be warned, if you make the stack tumble, you're meeeeowt!

Name: MicroMacro: Crime City – Full House: Another Bank Robbery
Description: An exclusive, kid friendly bonus case for MicroMacro: Crime City - Full House. Was bundled with preorders of MicroMacro: Crime City - Full House by German distributor Pegasus Spiele GmbH in August 2021.

Name: Trapped: Mission to Mars
Description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 4
Difficulty level: MEDIUM

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure. Each game is loads of fun as you move around the room actively solving puzzles and decoding clues. Every pack is different and contains everything you need to create your very own escape room experience. Packed with loads of content including clues to solve and puzzles to crack, all you need to add is family or friends to play and the cunning to escape/live the dream!

In Mission to Mars, you and your crew are on a mission to Mars! Approaching the red planet in search of a new Earth, you wake from your cryosleep pod, gasping for air… As the alarm echoes through the ship, your ears adjust to the message… It’s one no astronaut wants to hear: “WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! CRITICAL FAILURE!” A life-threatening system failure means you must now land the ship manually. Check your coordinates. Steady the thrusters. Solve the problems… Can you and your crew save the mission? The fate of humanity is in your hands!

Name: Trapped: The Zoo
Description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 5
Difficulty level: EASY

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... Each game is loads of fun as you move around the room actively solving puzzles and decoding clues. Every pack is different and contains everything you need to create your very own escape room experience. Packed with loads of content including clues to solve and puzzles to crack, all you need to add is family or friends to play and the cunning to escape/live the dream!

The Zoo: Find the Meerkats! In The Zoo, it’s the day you’ve been waiting for: your annual trip to the zoo! Excited, you upgrade your ticket to include a Personal Meerkat Experience. Under strict instructions to stay in the enclosure, the zookeeper leaves you to play with the meerkats. But wait! You do need to get your camera...A few seconds outside won’t hurt, surely? When you come back: disaster! The gate is ajar, and all eight meerkats are running into the distance! Now your team has a mission: work together, solve the puzzles and catch the meerkats! The future of the zoo is in your hands.

Name: Trapped: Flight 927
Description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 6
Difficulty level: HARD

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure... Each game is loads of fun as you move around the room actively solving puzzles and decoding clues. Every pack is different and contains everything you need to create your very own escape room experience. Packed with loads of content including clues to solve and puzzles to crack, all you need to add is family or friends to play and the cunning to escape/live the dream!

In Flight 927, the holiday you’ve been waiting for has finally arrived… Excited, you board the plane, looking forward to a week of relaxation. Not long into the flight, though, the plane starts to shudder. Suddenly, you’re losing altitude! Your stomach lunges as the plane plunges. Over the tannoy the pilot shouts, “Brace for impact!” Panicked, you adopt the brace position – and then… Darkness! As you regain consciousness, you open your eyes and realise the plane is down! Now it’s up to you to call for rescue. Can you get into the cockpit, send out a distress signal – and save the day?

Name: くくまる (Kukumaru)
Description:
ããã¾ã‚‹ (Kukumaru) is a game where players aim to get 6 of their discs in a row.  The discs are hollow cardboard rings that are red on one side and blue on the other.

The game has two modes: a "reflexes" real-time game and a "thinking" game.  In both, players use a deck of number cards to generate multiplication products that determines where the player puts a disc in a 6x6 grid of numbers.

In both games, the first player to get 6 in a row wins; if neither player achieves this when the cards run out, the player with more of their discs on the board wins.

The game includes a few variants, including one that adds Othello/Reversi rules.

Name: Enchanters: Darklands
Description:
All worlds contain blemishes on their maps. Kingdoms you don't travel to and would rather forget about even if you returned alive.
The Darklands expansion explores Enchantia's shadows.
Places full of terrors and forbidden magic, inhabited by ghosts, vampires, werewolves, trolls and other monsters of folklore.
Will you enter the Darklands? Or are you too scared? Muahahahah!

Craft your artifact and fight monsters. Glory awaits!

Enchanters: Darklands features 6 new Kingdom decks themed around ancient horror stories and folk tales. Use them the same way you would use any other Kingdom decks. Darklands decks feature new mechanics that allow you to develop new strategies.

Name: Flee the Dungeon!
Description:
Three brave heroes have been kidnapped by a wicked sorcerer and imprisoned inside a dungeon! To escape, they must recover their lost items, locate the dungeon key, and reach the exit—all while avoiding the dangers that lurk within the dungeon corridors. But beware the Sorcerer, whose arsenal of ferocious monsters, deadly traps, and powerful spells threaten to halt the heroes’ escape and entomb them in the dungeon forever...

Flee the Dungeon! is a fast-paced 3-on-1 tile placement game that’s easy to learn and highly replayable. Assuming the roles of the captured heroes, three players take turns placing dungeon tiles in hopes of locating their lost items and making their escape. The fourth player assumes the role of the Sorcerer, who wields an array of monsters and magical spells that can be used to stop the heroes from reaching safety. The gameplay makes use of resource management and light "press your luck" mechanics, giving players a wealth of strategies to explore with each playthrough. Each game plays in 60 minutes or less.

—description from the publisher

Name: ドワーフのネックレス工房 (Dowa-fu no Nekkuresu Koubou)
Description:
ãƒ‰ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ•ã®ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ¬ã‚¹å·¥æˆ¿ (Dowa-fu no Nekkuresu Koubou) can be translated to "The Dwarf Necklace Workshop".

There’s always a commotion at the Necklace Workshop where thirteen dwarves work as skilled craftsmen. Even though it’s critical that tasks be carried out in a timely manner, the sleepyhead dwarves never rush to get things done. As the proprietress of the workshop, you need to manage the dwarves’ various abilities in order to produce a beautiful necklace.

At the beginning of each round, the starting player (who holds the hearth card) selects one dwarf card from the two in their hand and places it so the card is visible to all other players. The remaining players then chose which card they will play from their hand. These cards should be revealed at the same time.

After the cards have been revealed, the player with the dwarf card of the lowest number gets to go first.

On their turn, players execute the abilities written on their dwarf card in order from top to bottom in order to build a necklace. After all abilities are executed, the player picks any card from the upper row of cards placed in the middle of the table and adds this card to his or her hand. If there are any jewels on this card, the player also receives them. Then, the player disposes their previously used card into the lower row.â€¨â€¨

This ends the player’s turn and the next player now starts his or her turn until all players have carried out one turn each.

â€¨â€¨At the end of the round, one jewel is drawn randomly from the jewel bag and placed onto any card remaining the the upper row in the middle of the table. Then, all cards in the lower round are moved into the upper row so that the row is replenished to a total of 5 cards.

Also at the end the round, the current starting player receives one jewel.â€¨

When a player completes stringing 8+ jewels onto their necklace string (6+ in case of a 3 player game), the game proceeds to the final round. The player with the highest valued necklace at the end of the game is the victor.

Name: Coded Castle
Description:
Objective
All players play on the same team against a ghost that haunts the coded castle. Their task is to play the role of a wise sorcerer defending the fortress and collect four treasures before the ghost reaches the top of the castle tower.

How to play?
Although you all play on the sorcerer’s team, each player makes their own moves each turn. Of course, this does not mean that you cannot consult other players – many sorcerers are better than one! Each turn starts with drawing three cards in a pile and putting them in a row. The youngest sorcerer on the team starts their turn and then performs the moves indicated by the cards in order (left to right). After the moves are completed, the used cards are put aside and the next three cards are drawn and put in a row by the next player. You can also play alone and go on a creative and exciting adventure when there are no other board game lovers nearby!

You can draw:

     arrow cards: move the sorcerer to an adjacent field on the board, in the direction indicated by the arrow. NOTE: in each turn, you can rotate up to two of these cards by 90° in any direction, or you can leave them as they were lined up;
     loop cards: repeat the movements indicated by the cards to the left of this card twice, one by one, if this card is placed first from the left, it remains inactive;
     sorcerer cards: move to any of adjacent fields on the left, right, above or below;
     ghost cards: move the ghost token one field up.


There are special fields on the board, which may make it easier (or more difficult) for you to collect treasures:

     if you enter a teleportation gate field, you can magically move the sorcerer to any other gate field;
     if you enter or pass through a field with a sorcerer’s wand, you 


 can move the ghost token one field down;

     you cannot stop or pass through the ghost fields; turn the arrows to walk around them.


When you enter the treasure field, put it in one of the boxes at the top of the board. If you use all the cards before the end of the game, shuffle them carefully and stack them again (since there are 35 cards, only two cards are dealt in the last turn). If the sequence you draw makes movement impossible (for example: even after turning the cards you hit a ghost field or you can’t walk because of the end of the route), you move the ghost token one field up. You will win if you collect all the treasures before the ghost moves to the last field of its route and leaves the castle tower.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Infinity CodeOne: Operation Crimson Stone
Description:
Operation: Crimson Stone Battle Pack is a box containing 14 miniatures belonging to the two different armies of the Nomads and Ariadna, an introductory ruleset, cardboard scenery, dice — everything you need to start collecting Infinity CodeOne or just to complete your collection!

In addition to this, Operation: Crimson Stone is the official way to introduce yourself to the Infinity CodeOne ruleset, as it includes a full color rulebook with 5 tutorial missions to teach you how to play, making it easy to understand the Infinity CodeOne core mechanics.

In this booklet you will also find the background and troop profiles of all the troops in the Battle Pack. There is also a brief guide to the Infinity universe and advice on exploring it in more detail.

Operation: Crimson Stone contains 2 totally new Starter Packs of two brand new factions: Nomads, a coalition of three colossal ships, and Ariadna, founded by the descendants of the first human colony ship. A total of 14 highly detailed metal miniatures!

—description from the publisher

Name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Four
Description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 4 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
Ethiopia 2M BC
Hong Kong 1500 AD
North Atlantic 1912 AD
Detriot 2050 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
Jinichi Kawakami
Ukifune Jinnai
Miracle Kazane

Name: Infinity Defiance: Megalodron
Description: The Megalodron expansion adds the massive Megalodron enemy to Infinity Defiance.  Included in the box are the Megalodron PVC miniature, 1 Megalodron enemy card, 4 Megalodron initiative cards, and an alternative final mission for the Core set, mission 13.

Name: The Day is Ours!: The Battle of Princeton, 1777
Description:
The Day is Ours! The Battle of Princeton, 1777, simulates this crucial battle of the American Revolutionary War. Following their surprise victory at Trenton, the Americans marched throughout the night to strike at the rear of the British-held city of Princeton. Washington urged his troops on, declaring “The day is ours!”

—description from the publisher

Name: Fulcrum Leader
Description:
Fulcrum Leader is a solitaire tactical game which depicts the conventional Soviet air campaign against NATO in Europe during the Cold War era. The game covers the crucial decades from 1970s to 1990s as opposing forces faced each other down in a game of nuclear brinkmanship, with featured aircraft including the MiG-29 Fulcrum, MiG-23/27 Flogger, MiG-21 Fishbed, MiG-25 Foxbat, Su-27 Flanker, Su-24 Fencer and Su-17 Fitter.

In Fulcrum Leader, you will need to select the right combination of aircraft in your regiment in order to successfully carry out the different missions which your pilots will execute. You will be faced with the same type of decision-making and risk-taking experienced by Soviet air regimental commanders.

This game adds new aspects of Soviet air operations such as enhanced radio-electric combat, ground controlled intercepts (GCI), and the ever-present political officer watching over your shoulders, the Zampolit. You will need to manage the capability of your pilots, weigh the advantages and disadvantages of your aircraft, use your zampolit to manage your superiors, and avoid the ignoble fate of being sent off to a re-education facility in Kamchatka.

The core game contains 336 cards and 704 counters, including:


     207 x Aircraft cards
         MiG-21bis Fishbed-N
         MiG-23ML Flogger-G
         MiG-27 Flogger-J
         MiG-29 Fulcrum-A (USSR / Bulgaria / Czechoslovakia / DDR / Poland / Romania)
         MiG-29 Fulcrum-C
         Su-17M Fitter
         Su-24 Fencer
         Su-27 Flanker
    
     5 x Squadron Asset cards
         MiG-25RB/RBV Foxbat-B
         MiG-25RBSh Foxbat-D
         MiG-25BM Foxbat-F
         Su-25 Frogfoot
    
     18 x Support Aircraft cards
         Yak-28PP Brewer-E
         Tu-126 Moss
         A-50 Mainstay
    
     9 x Ground Control Intercept cards
     45 x Target cards
     36 x Event cards
     16 x Zampolit cards


In addition, the core box includes:


     11 x Campaign sheets
     3 x Player Help sheets
     1 x Airbase Squadron Control sheet
     1 x Player Log sheet
     1 x Tactical Display board
     1 x Rulebook


—description from the publisher

Name: Identity Theft
Description:
Identity Theft is not a joke. It’s a game!

As skilled digital hackers, attempt to infiltrate your opponents’ defenses and piece together their Identification Numbers. Use the Black Market to attack, defend, and engage in Risky Business. Use your hacking skills at the opportune moments and be careful who you trust. The first hacker to steal all other’s identities is the victor, so do whatever it takes to keep your own identity safe!

Don’t forget to be vigilant! An Undercover Cop or White Hat Hacker can disrupt your schemes at any moment. If you can secure control of the elusive and adorable Botnet your chances for success skyrocket. So what are you waiting for? Get lost in the black market. Release your inner hacker. Show off your best evil grin. Who will you hack first?

Identity Theft - it’s Risky Business!

Each player starts the game with a randomized identity code.  Players then play cards to steal information about the code or defend from the attackes.  The first player to guess an opponent's identity code wins.

Name: Specter Ops: Arctic Archives
Description:
Fans of Specter Ops can now infiltrate a new Raxxon location with this super-sized Arctic Archives map. The other side of the game board is the corrected map from Specter Ops: Broken Covenant - Abandoned Headquarters.

There are 8 terminals on the Arctic Archives side of the board. At the start of an agent or hunter player’s turn, if they are adjacent to a terminal, they may place up to
3 barriers on the board and then proceed with their turn.

Arctic Archives also features 6 supply caches.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pickit: Dragons
Description:
Pickit is a card game family with very simple rules. Game start for new players is extremely quick and by playing they continue to explore more.
Dragons is the first game in the series. In Pickit Dragons you collect the cards in order to build complete Dragons in your play area which will then provide you with game advantage for the following rounds. 
What makes pickit set collection special is that each dragon has different number of cards 
Green dragon - 1 card, Red dragon - 2 cards, Yellow dragon - 3 cards, Blue dragon - 4 cards and Purple dragon - 5 cards. 
Based on the size of the dragon you gain points and if dragon doesn't contain any jokers you get also the extra power which you can use from next round on.

Game end is triggered when certain number of points is reached by one of the players.

For more challenging game play you can also use mission cards which you can play as private or common objectives.

Art is very appealing and as there are more designs for each colour of the dragon in each game your dragons will look little differently!

—description from the publisher

Name: 1:0 für mich
Description:
In this simple soccer game, you just move a ball by rolling the dice. The point on which the ball lies indicates which player/team is allowed to roll the dice. The dice indicates one of the 6 ways the ball is moved to the next point. If the ball gets into a scoring position, there is a 1:6 chance of scoring a goal. The game is won by the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary

Name: Pixel Clash
Description:
In Pixel Clash, 1-6 people can work alone or fight as a team to take down a deadly Dragon and its minions.

The theme of the game is Colourful, Fantasy and Pixel Art.

During setup, each person selects a Player card (e.g. Wizard) selects a Dragon to face-off against (e.g. Blue Dragon) and then the Dragon Action deck is setup (a collection of 14 random Dragon Action cards, and the Game Over card at the bottom).

Each round, Players draw and play 1 Player Action card. Players then draw a single Dragon Action card for the Dragon (off the top of its deck). All cards are resolved in order of the priority number on the cards (highest first).

If all Players die or the Game Over card is drawn - all players lose. If the Dragon's HP drops to 0 - all Players win.

Also, some cards can cause "Minions" to be drawn. Minions stay active until defeated, and can become a nuisance if left to get out of hand (multiple minions can be active at once).

—description from the designer

Name: Deutschland Tour
Description:
On a round trip through Germany, the players start with their game piece in Berlin. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and receives a question from the question booklet, depending on where he is. If the player gives the correct answer, he may advance the number of dice rolled, otherwise he must stop. The player who reaches Berlin first wins the game. There are two different question booklets, one for children and another for teenagers and adults.

—user summary

Name: El Gran Asado
Description:
El Gran Asado (The Big Barbecue) is a 2-4 player game where players must bet cards to get resource tokens, and then they must exchange those tokens to get more elaborate resource tokens. They can also play action cards to get money or harm other players. The first player to get a Bread, Steak and Wine token and have more than $ 1,000 wins the game.

Each player starts with 5 cards in hand, $ 250 and a resource board. Put the betting board on the center of the table, along with the Asado card.

Each round is played in two phases:

Card Play Phase
During their turn, each player can trade tokens, sell resources to the bank, and play action cards.

Betting Phase
When all players played their cards, the resource betting phase starts. Each player will bet their resource cards (Wheat, Calf, Vineyard and Producer) in the betting board. After betting their cards and throwing the die, the player will claim the corresponding prizes in tokens, and place them in their resource board.

Before ending their turn, they can trade again tokens for more elaborated resources using the cards in their hands, or sell tokens to the bank to get more money.

Once all players have finished betting, all cards are returned to the deck. The obtained tokens remain in their resource boards. A new round starts and 5 cards are dealed to each player.

Name: Pumpkin Express
Description:
Pumpkin Express, part of Roll and Write Revolution, is a train game of developing routes from one pumpkin patch to the next. While doing so, players will be placing stations, which then allow them to help ghostly passengers get on board 1 of 3 train cars. Ghost passengers have particular likes of other ghosts within the car.

Players will have to carefully plan the order they place passengers in the queue as those passengers are placed in the cars in the order that they are placed in the queue. The dice are also used to create the tracks.

—description from the designer

Name: Sic'Em
Description:
Sic’Em is a 2-5 player card game with an average play time of 10-15 minutes.

Based on the classic card game “War”, Sic’Em adds depth and flavor by introducing fantastical characters with unique abilities!

Played in 10 rounds, players first set creature cards face down, then simultaneously reveal them to determine a round winner based on the highest numbered card.  The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!  Characters with unique abilities can be used to shape the outcome of the game.

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific – For the Emperor
Description:
For the Emperor is a Battle-pack expansion for Heroes of the Pacific from the Lock and Load Tactical system. Included are eight brand-new scenarios. It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics. The scenarios span the entire length of the war, starting with the Japanese invasion of Wake Island and the Philippine Islands. From the bloody last days of the Japanese on Guadalcanal to the frustrating static warfare on Bougainville.

We witness some of the last and largest Banzai attacks on Guam and Saipan. The close and dirty work of clearing Japanese cave networks on Peleliu and then things come full circle as the Allies return to liberate the Philippine Islands.

For The Emperor, Battlepack is all about the Imperial Japanese Army, and the US Military forces. Get ready to return to the Pacific with For the Emperor!

Name: Santa Monica: The Long Weekend
Description: It’s the long weekend in Santa Monica, and people are out at various events around town including concerts, sand castle competitions, restaurant openings, and more. Santa Monica: The Long Weekend comes with double wide event cards that can be added to your town, but when you do other players will join the party and get benefits too! Aside from the 14 double sized event cards, owners will also get 12 drafting cards and a brand new scoring tile. Have fun this weekend, it's going to be a hot one!

Name: Spy Car
Description:
You are a Secret Agent. You have the best gadgets, the best smile, the best lines, the most fashionable wardrobe. And the coolest thing you have is your awesome Spy Car. You have all the goodies at your disposal, Oil Slicks, Machine guns, Rockets, Tire slicers, Armor, Solid Rocket Boosters, ejection seats, MP3 player, GPS, and often a supermodel or famous love interest in the passenger seat. You’ll need all that and more if you wish to out maneuver and out gun all the goons, ninjas, and thugs trying to run you off the road. So make sure your clothes are impeccable, your hair in place, and buckle up for a ride!

In Spy Car, you have one goal. Eliminate enough of the Bad Guy's cars to force out the Boss Car. Kill the Boss Car and you win. If you lose all your Vehicle Damage or Health before then, you lose.

You start the game with 6 gadget cards, which give you special abilities above and beyond what you can normally do with your die rolls. You also place out a grid of enemy vehicles cards according to the diagram on the city you are in.

Each turn, you roll 8 standard dice, and 1-4 specialty dice, which are skewed to certain abilities.  The specialty dice can give you certain results you are looking for easier, but there is also a Danger result not found in the regular dice, so you need to weigh that risk into your decision on how many to roll. You will use the die results for their basic abilities, or to power up gadgets or combos, which will help you eliminate the enemy's spy vehicles.

Your goal is to eliminate the Boss Car at the end of the wave. Once 10 vehicles are eliminated, the Boss Car comes out. You win the game if you eliminate the Boss. You lose the game if either your health or vehicle damage is reduced to zero.

Name: Ninja Galaxy: The Ninja Masters
Description:
The Ninja Masters expansion to Ninja Galaxy:
- Updates some of the base game rules to inject more strategic decision making.  
- Improves the capabilities of the Ninja Pawns from the base game with special abilities.
- Adds one-time-use Ninja Master cards to each faction.  These Ninja Masters "transfer" Wisdom, Experience, and Fighting ability into a Ninja Pawn for one action.

The new components include updated wooden Ninja Pawns, the Ninja Master cards, and Marking Cards to track hit-point loses.

Name: Pirates Under Fire: Mercernary Ship Promo Tile
Description:
A promo tile to add to the game.
It follows the same rule as the other mercernary ship tiles.

Power: when you place this tile (after paying 4 gold), you activate the power of the 3 possible ships of your color that surround it (left/right and above).

Name: Postcard Guadalcanal
Description:
A couple weeks ago my 11 year old daughter beat me in this in a typical last-minute cliff-hanger game.

The game is so unpredictable - all the chances are 50% die rolls or coin tosses - it is ideal for solitaire play too.

8 half-month turns for U.S. or Japan to take and keep Henderson Field, Guadalcanal.
2 battleship, 2 cruiser - a 3rd for U.S. if/when 1 is lost - 2 carrier, and 2 transport pieces each, plus Yamato for Japanese if an IJN battleship piece is lost.
6 ground units each
5 U.S. and 4 Japanese air units.

Codebreaking, night combat, radar, Torpedo Junction, Long Lance torpedoes for Japanese cruisers with Night surprise.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 3 (so far) postcard games off in postcard format ... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components ... the front at both A4 (for the units) and A3 (for the chart) and the back/rules as large as you need them.  :-) )
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Dilemma
Description:
Each trick consists of four cards, one of each suit. Non-dealer leads to the first trick and the winner of each subsequent trick leads to the next. Any card may be led.
 Playing second to a trick, you must choose one from a different suit. If you play a higher card than the one led then you play the third card, again of a different suit, and the leader plays a card of the fourth suit. But if your second card is equal to or lower than the first card, then the leader plays the third card and you the fourth.
 The trick is won by the player whose two cards played to the trick count highest when totalled, taking numerals 2 to 10 at face value, Jack 11, Queen 12, King 13, Ace 14. If tied, then it is won by the player whose two cards produce the higher total when multiplied together. If still equal, then you will both have played equal cards. In this event the trick-winner is whoever was the first to play the highest-ranking card.

Name: For Glory: Champions Expansion
Description: The Champions expansion brings you back into the arenas of ancient Rome, this time with up to 4 players. New upgradeable champion cards, and other new mechanics add layers of depth while tons of new supply cards provide endless replayability. Play solo against the Ludus Magnus for a true test of mettle.

Name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: The Little Beak Guesthouse
Description:
It’s the busy season at the Ugly Gryphon Inn! The bar is crowded, the inn is rapidly filling up, and you are going to have to take drastic measures – but opening up the adjacent guesthouse. The Little Beak, the quaint little guesthouse next to the Inn, is technically liveable and has been free of pyro-rats for several days now. Might as well open it up and collect a few extra coins!

When selecting a patron at the bar to go to to sleep, you may now add that patron to the Little Beak guesthouse instead of the inn.

When a patron is added to the guesthouse, the guesthouse is checked for irks from the top down. The regular inn is not checked.

To win, The Little Beak must have 3 patrons at the end of the game. However, there is a twist. The guesthouse can only have, at most, one of each quirk (noise, fight, smell) in the guesthouse.

Name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: Innployees
Description:
As you carry a tower of twenty filled pint glasses across a bar filled with fighting, smelly patrons you have an epiphany – you need to hire some help!
